page.title: 19Railways.
page.content: A major railway passes through our area. The first railway line to Colchester was built by Eastern Counties Railway in 1843. The Eastern Railway,and later the London and North Eastern Railway Station developed as a major centre for passenger and freight traffic.In 1962 the line to Clacton joined British Rail's electrified network when the full electric train service began running from Liverpool St.The overhead wires,carrying 25,000 volts, are now being extended to Norwich and Harwich and will be completed in 1987.The electrification has now passed through Colchester and bridges have had to be altered. Policemen showed a film about the dangers of electricity to local school children. Every weekday 230 passenger and 50 freight trains pass through the area.
